p: Another promising biodegradable polymer is the MaterBi ® or, better, the MaterBi ® family, including a series of bioplastics coming from modified starch and/or synthetic biodegradable polyesters [ 28, 29]. It found applications in several fields due to good mechanical properties, thermal stability, barrier properties, as well as good processability and compostability [ 30, 31, 32]. Another recent example of biodegradable/compostable polymer is the Bioflex ® family, typically based on biodegradable polymers such as PLA and thermoplastic copolyesters, such as PBAT [ 33, 34, 35, 36, 37].
